title: Are there any good books or websites where a teenager (I’m 15) can learn about investing, saving money, etc.? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is a big investing universe out there from different assets eg stocks, commodities, forex, etc to different styles eg fundamentals vs technicals, quant vs discretionary I suggest that you get to know all of them at a basic level first. Look up Investopedia and Wikipedia. Once you have some basic knowledge then you can decide which path to follow based on what interest you, your educational background Thereafter you can go into more study about the path you follow
Many sites have tutorials for beginners - Morningstar, MSN, Investopedia, etc. Read Investing for Dummies or Personal Finance for Dummies, both by Eric Tyson.

“Everyday Millionaires” by Chris Hogan “Financial Peace University” by Dave Ramsey “The Next Millionaire Next Door” by Sarah Stanley Fallaw and Thomas J. Stanley “Your Money or Your Life” by Joseph R. Dominguez, Monique Tilford, and Vicki Robin
